I hope in this time of sadness and loss, we can find new strength to come together as a nation and foster greater respect for one another," Kirsten Gillibrand said in a statement before leaving. We may never make any sense of this heinous crime, but I remember how Gabrielle Giffords so often urged people to stand up to the violent language that divides us, and focus on solutions. That is exactly what we need to do right now, Kirsten Gillibrand said. "I want to thank Barack Obama for his compassionate leadership at this time of great national tragedy. My thoughts and prayers are with all the victims of this horrible tragedy, their loved

parents and her husband. "We were telling her how proud we were of her and how she was inspiring the whole nation with her courage and with her strength," Kirsten Gillibrand said. Then Debbie Wasserman Schultz and I started joking about all the things we were going to do when she got better. We were holding her hand, and she was responding to our hand-holding, she was rubbing her hands and she was gripping our hands so we could... we knew she could hear and understand what we were saying, she moved her leg. We knew she was responding. The lawmakers continued to joke about what they were going to do together, and as they did so, Gabrielle Giffords "started to open her eyes, literally," Kirsten Gillibrand said.
